We follow our earlier work ( 34) and use the GPCC metadata to define a mask (fixed over the entire period) by identifying all land-based grid boxes that contain at least one measurement site. The mask includes 1,987 grid boxes (about 69% of global land area, excluding Antarctica). We adopted the post-1940 period, because earlier work showed almost identical results in terms of mean and variance between GPCC and six other global
P
databases over this period ( 34).
